intro: Caucalis xanthotricha, commonly known as the yellow-haired caucalis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Caucalis xanthotricha is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
